projects.title: Gun Cabinet
projects.description: Custom gun cabinet built from pine with raised panel sides, slotted barrel rack, and lower drawers for ammunition and accessories. Finished with a dark walnut stain.

hero.alt: Finished gun cabinet loaded with rifles

entries.alt: Unfinished gun cabinet in the workshop before staining
Close-up of the raised side panel detail after staining
Finished cabinet from a wider angle with rifles loaded

projects.title: Small Desk
projects.description: Custom desk with a painted hardwood frame and stained top. Built to explore traditional woodworking joints including mortise and tenon construction for the base.

hero.alt: Finished desk with stained top and black painted frame

entries.alt: Desk base frame clamped during glue-up
Painted frame with unfinished top panel ready for assembly
Assembled desk with top attached to painted frame

projects.title: Napkin Holder
projects.description: Mixed-material napkin holder combining woodworking, blacksmithing, and brazing. The upright was hand-forged and brazed to a crossbar, then captured in the wood tray through blind-drilled holes.

hero.alt: Napkin holder showing wood tray with forged metal crossbar

entries.alt: Top-down view showing the brazed T-joint and forged flat end
Walnut version of the napkin holder in use with napkins

projects.title: Black Epoxy Furniture Set
projects.description: Matching furniture set designed from the ground up — welded steel bases with epoxy river tops and seats. Designed the bases, did all the welding and painting, then made the seats and table top using the epoxy river technique with black epoxy and natural wood edges.

hero.alt: Matching bar stools with epoxy river seats at a kitchen counter

entries.alt: Bar stools in the workshop with epoxy river seats on welded frames
Coffee table in the workshop showing epoxy river top on steel frame
Finished coffee table in the living room

projects.title: Claro Walnut Coffee Table
projects.description: Coffee table built around a stunning claro walnut cookie slab. The base is an original design — steel rods cut, bent, and brazed together mid-air to form a spider web structure reminiscent of a 3D stained glass window. Same brazed joinery technique from the napkin holder, scaled up.

hero.alt: Claro walnut cookie slab on brazed spider web steel base

entries.alt: Top-angle view in the workshop showing the slab grain and base below
Close-up of the claro walnut grain pattern
Finished table in the living room by the stone fireplace

projects.title: Console Table with Drawers
projects.description: Custom console table for a client combining a welded steel base with a stained wood body and drawers. Designed from a single sketch with dimensions — no CAD model, just built in space. Brought together welding large bases and the technical woodworking of building functional drawers.

hero.alt: Finished console table with stained wood drawers and steel base

entries.alt: Initial design sketch on notebook paper with dimensions
Unfinished wood carcass and drawer box in the workshop
Side view showing the stained wood body on welded steel base
Front view with drawer open showing construction and hardware

projects.title: Toy Storage Shelf
projects.description: Custom toy storage shelf with multiple bin sizes, integrated bungee cord sections for large stuffed animals, and color-coded bins. A lesson in designing around different materials and existing objects — every compartment was sized to fit specific bins.

hero.alt: Finished toy storage shelf with colorful bins in different sizes

entries.alt: Top-down view of the compartment layout before bins

projects.title: Pub Table
projects.description: Pub table with a wood slab top filled with black epoxy for the voids and a welded steel base with extreme splayed joint angles. The base was a particularly difficult weld — getting all four legs to meet at compound angles required careful layout and fixture work. Later built a matching side table for the same client using the same X-base concept with a walnut and green epoxy river top.

hero.alt: Finished pub table in home with epoxy-filled slab top on welded steel base

entries.alt: Raw slab in epoxy mold showing voids and cracks before filling
Welded steel base with splayed legs and compound angle joints
Finished slab top with black epoxy fills sanded smooth
Grinding the welded X-base in the workshop with sparks flying
Matching side table with walnut and green epoxy river top on X-base
Close-up of the walnut and green epoxy river top showing grain detail
End view of the side table showing the X-base and epoxy river

projects.title: Memorial Flag Box
projects.description: Custom memorial flag display box incorporating the recipient's dog tags and bullet casings from their 21-gun salute. Features a triangular flag compartment with custom-cut glass, a channel for the casings and dog tags, and a live-edge spalted panel. Another sketch-to-build project — high detail work for a meaningful purpose.

hero.alt: Finished memorial flag box with custom glass, bullet casings, and dog tags

entries.alt: Initial concept sketch in sketchbook
Close-up of bullet casings and dog tags between flag glass and live-edge panel

projects.title: Brass Wire Joinery Tables
projects.description: 100% original design — my favorite pieces. Invented a technique of bending brass rods into 90-degree corners and packing them into the steel tube construction to create a decorative structural joint. Built the side table first, then loved the technique so much it expanded into a matching console table. Walnut round top on a steel and brass frame.

hero.alt: Finished side table with walnut top and brass wire joinery on steel frame

entries.alt: Steel tube frame in the workshop with brass rods bent around corners
Close-up of the brass wire joinery technique — rods packed into the tube at the joint
Top-down view of the walnut top grain
